attributes.action: Take the age cap off the care leaver bursary in higher education.
attributes.additional_details:
Higher education providers can choose to remove the age cap, however most keep the cap at 25 because that is the age many local authorities work to.

Last year 37% of undergraduate students were mature students. And "care leavers who do go to university are less likely to do so straight from school at age 18, and only 11.8% enter by age 23." (UCAS, 2021).
Taking the age cap off care leaver bursaries would mean that higher education providers have a better picture of when care experienced people enter higher education, and will be better placed to offer support.
attributes.background: Many higher education providers offer care leaver bursaries. Definitions of care vary, but often mature care leavers (over the age of 25/26) cannot access the bursary unless they were under 25 at the start of their course.
